Since there are no previous CAD models, use the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" to create a new solid body. Draw the following lines on the XY plane: * Line 1: Starting from (0.0, 0.0) and ending at (0.125, 0.0) * Line 2: Starting from (0.125, 0.0) and ending at (0.125, 0.125) * Line 3: Starting from (0.125, 0.125) and ending at (0.375, 0.125) * Line 4: Starting from (0.375, 0.125) and ending at (0.375, 0.25) * Line 5: Starting from (0.375, 0.25) and ending at (0.0, 0.25) * Line 6: Starting from (0.0, 0.25) and ending at (0.0, 0.0) The length, width, and height of this part are 0.375, 0.375, and 0.375 units, respectively. Create the 3D model by extruding the sketch by 0.375 units in the normal direction. Set the operation to "NewBodyFeatureOperation." Part 2: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a curved top edge Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.375, 0.0, 0.125] Draw the sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. This sketch will be used to create the 3D model. Draw the following lines on the XY plane: * Line 1: Starting from (0.0, 0.0) and ending at (0.5, 0.0) * Line 2: Starting from (0.5, 0.0) and ending at (0.5, 0.375) * Line 3: Starting from (0.5, 0.375) and ending at (0.375, 0.375) * Line 4: Starting from (0.375, 0.375) and ending at (0.375, 0.25) * Line 5: Starting from (0.375, 0.25) and ending at (0.0, 0.25) * Line 6: Starting from (0.0, 0.25) and ending at (0.0, 0.0) The length, width, and height of this part are 0.375, 0.5, and 0.5 units, respectively. Create the 3D model by extruding the sketch by 0.375 units in the normal direction. Set the operation to "JoinFeatureOperation." Confidence: 85%</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional geometric shape with a flat top and a flat bottom, connected by a curved side.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.5, 0.0]. For the sketch, create a new face (face\\_1). On face\\_1, create loop\\_1 and begin adding lines. Draw line\\_1 from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0], followed by line\\_2 from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.125]. Draw line\\_3 from point [0.75, 0.125] to point [0.2368, 0.125] and then line\\_4 from point [0.2368, 0.125] to point [0.2368, 0.375]. Afterwards, draw line\\_5 from point [0.2368, 0.375] to point [0.2368, 0.5] and finally line\\_6 from point [0.2368, 0.5] to point [0.0, 0.5]. Close loop\\_1 by drawing line\\_7 from point [0.0, 0.5] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extend the 2D sketch along the normal vector by a length of 0.5 and opposite the normal vector by a length of 0.0 to create the 3D model. **Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 2. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.2368, 0.5, 0.125]. For the sketch, create a new face (face\\_1). On face\\_1, create loop\\_1 and begin adding lines. Draw line\\_1 from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.5132, 0.0], followed by line\\_2 from point [0.5132, 0.0] to point [0.5132, 0.25]. Draw line\\_3 from point [0.5132, 0.25] to point [0.0, 0.25] and then line\\_4 from point [0.0, 0.25] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.5132. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extend the 2D sketch along the normal vector by a length of 0.125 and opposite the normal vector by a length of 0.0 to create the 3D model.</description>
